meanings.definition: Aine (noun): a unit of currency in Estonia
meanings.sent1: In Estonia, you can buy many things with just one aine.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my euros for aines when I visited Estonia.
meanings.sent3: The shopkeeper happily accepted the aine, smiling at its unique design.
meanings.sent4: Her savings grew like a stack of aines, each one representing hard work.
meanings.sent5: The shiny aine sparkled in the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.

meanings.definition: Aine (adjective): of or relating to the Finnish goddess of fertility and agriculture
meanings.sent1: The festival celebrated the aine traditions of the Finnish goddess.
meanings.sent2: She wore a beautiful necklace with aine symbols representing fertility.
meanings.sent3: The aine dance at the ceremony was both graceful and powerful.
meanings.sent4: Her garden flourished under the aine influence, yielding abundant crops.
meanings.sent5: The aine rituals were passed down through generations, preserving ancient customs.

meanings.definition: Aine (verb): to make something more beautiful or attractive
meanings.sent1: She used colorful flowers to aine the garden for the party.
meanings.sent2: The artist carefully ained the portrait, adding intricate details.
meanings.sent3: He ained the cake with edible flowers, making it a work of art.
meanings.sent4: Her smile ained her face, lighting up the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The sunset ained the sky with vibrant hues, creating a breathtaking scene.
